circumstances: The airplane landed hard on its belly after the pilot forgot to lower the landing gear on approach. Upon touchdown, he decided to initiate a go-around manoeuvre when the cargo shifted as it was not properly secured. The airplane stalled and crashed in flames. The aircraft was damaged beyond repair and the pilot, sole on board, was seriously injured.
probable_cause:
Hard and wheels-up landing following an improper level off. The following contributing factors were reported:
- Inadequate preflight preparation, 
- cargo shifted as improperly secured,
- No cargo net or rope found in the cabin, 
- First flight in this model.
